column3: Group code
column5: Whether or not detailed requirements are provided

column3: Contents of property
This property indicates the ON/OFF status.
This property indicates the installation location
This property indicates the version number of the corresponding standard.
column4: First byte: Fixed at 0x00 (for future reserved). Second byte: Fixed at 0x00 (for future reserved). Third byte: Indicates the order of release in the ASCII format. Fourth byte: Fixed at 0x00 (for future reserved).

column3: A number that allows each object to be uniquely identified.
column4: First byte: lower-layer communication ID field 0x01.0xFD: This is a communication protocol used in the lower-layer communication and is set arbitrarily according to the protocol class in the case where unique number is assigned (not used in ECHONET Lite). 0x11.0x1F: Power line Communication Protocol a and d systems 0x31.0x3F: Low-Power Radio Communication Protocol 0x41.0x4F: Extended HBS 0x51.0x5F: IrDA 0x61.0x6F: LonTalk 0x71.0x7F: Bluetooth 0x81.0x8F: Ethernet 0x91.0x9F: IEEE802.11/11b 0xA1: Power line Communication Protocol c systems 0xB1: IPv6/Ethernet 0xB2: IPv6/6LoWPAN 0xFE: 2.17 bytes are defined by the manufacturer, and are set according to the type. 0xFF: 2.9 bytes are defined when randomly generated protocol is used in the lower-layer communication. 0x00: Identification number is not set. Second and succeeding bytes: unique number field

column3: This property indicates the instantaneous power consumption of the device in watts.
This property indicates the cumulative power consumption of the device in increments of 0.001kWh.
This property indicates the manufacturer-defined fault code.
column4: First byte: Indicates the data size of the fault code field. Second to fourth bytes: Manufacturer code Fifth and succeeding bytes: Field for manufacturer-defined fault code

column3: This property indicates the current limit setting (0.100%).
This property indicates whether a fault (e.g. a sensor trouble) has occurred or not.
column4: Fault  occurred=0x41,  No  fault  has occurred=0x42

column3: Describes the fault.
3-byte manufacturer code
3-byte business facility code
Identifies the product using ASCII code.
This property indicates the production number using ASCII code.
4-byte production date code
column4: This property indicates the production date in the YYMD format (1 character = 1 byte). YY: Year (e.g. 1999=0x07CF) M: Month (e.g. December=0x0C) D: Day (e.g. 20th=0x14)

column3: This property indicates whether the device is operating in power-saving mode.
column4: Operating in power-saving mode =0x41 Operating in normal operation mode =0x42

column3: This property indicates whether remote control is through a public network or not.
column4: Not through a public network=0x41 Through a public network=0x42

column3: Current time (HH: MM format)
Current date (YYYY: MM: DD format)
This property indicates the power limit setting in watts.
This property indicates the cumulative number of days, hours, minutes or seconds for which the device has operated, using 1 byte for the unit and 4 bytes for the time.
column4: First byte: Indicates the unit. Second: 0x41; Minute: 0x42; Hour: 0x43; Day:0x44 Second to fifth bytes: Indicates the elapsed time in the unit specified by the first byte. 0x00000000.0xFFFFFFFD (0.4294967295)

column3: See Appendix 1.
